data.author: Arshiya Chopra
data.content: A sewer worker in Spain contracted Strongyloides stercoralis, a species of parasitic roundworm, seen crawling under his skin in a rare case, the University Hospital in Madrid stated. The 64-year-old man had experienced mild diarrhoea and an itchy rash before seeking medical attention. Pictures showed outlines of the initial placement of the larvae and how they moved within 24 hours.
data.title: Worms seen crawling under man's skin in rare case in Spain; pics released

data.author: Apaar Sharma
data.content: A 61-year-old Kolkata man has become the first person in the world to contract a fatal plant fungal disease. The man, who worked as a plant mycologist, visited hospital after suffering from a hoarse voice, cough, fatigue and difficulty in swallowing. Scans showed he had paratracheal abscess in his neck and testing of pus samples revealed infection by Chondrostereum purpureum.
data.title: Kolkata man infected with deadly plant fungus in world's first case

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on Sunday successfully conducted the Reusable Launch Vehicle Autonomous Landing Mission (RLV LEX) in Chitradurga, Karnataka. The vehicle was carried to an altitude of 4.5 km on the IAF's Chinook Helicopter, before being released for an autonomous landing on a runway, marking the first time for a winged body in the world, ISRO said.
data.title: ISRO successfully tests autonomous landing of its reusable launch vehicle

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Scientists from The University of Western Australia and Japan set a world record after they filmed a fish swimming 8,336 metre below sea level in Japan. This marks the deepest ever observation of a fish, beating the previous record set at 8,178 metre in Mariana Trench. The species is a type of unknown snailfish of the genus Pseudoliparis, scientists said.
data.title: World's deepest fish filmed swimming 8 km below sea level in Japan

data.author: Apaar Sharma
data.content: A Great Indian Bustard chick has been successfully hatched from artificially reared birds in Jaisalmer. "The chick has been successfully hatched from an egg laid by a 3-year-old female who also hatched artificially from an egg collected from the wild for the first time," Union Minister Bhupender Yadav tweeted. The GIB is listed as critically endangered in IUCN Red List.
data.title: Great Indian Bustard chick hatched from artificially reared birds in Jaisalmer, pic released

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: NASA on Monday announced the four astronauts who will venture around the Moon on Artemis II. Christina Koch, Jeremy Hansen, Victor Glover and Reid Wiseman will fly a capsule around the lunar body late next year or early in 2025. They won't land on the Moon but will pave the way for a touchdown by a subsequent crew.
data.title: NASA names four astronauts for its Moon mission

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a picture of a celestial object that lies about 390 million lightyears from Earth in the constellation Lyra. It is sometimes defined as an active galactic nucleus, sometimes as a quasar, and sometimes as a Seyfert galaxy. "It's all these things all at once because these three definitions have significant overlap," NASA said.
data.title: Pic shows celestial object that seems to be three different things at once

data.author: Daisy Mowke
data.content: Astronomers have observed an explosion 180 million light years away, that appeared much flatter than ever thought possible and is shaped almost like a flat disk. The explosion has been classified as a Fast Blue Optical Transient (FBOT), an extremely rare class of explosion. Scientists made the discovery after spotting a flash of polarised light completely by chance.
data.title: Flattest explosion ever seen in space discovered by astronomers

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: A study has found that higher levels of naturally occurring lithium in the household tap water of women who are pregnant may increase the risk of autism spectrum disorder in children. The risk of autism increased as lithium levels increased, the study found. The association was found to be stronger in urban areas.
data.title: High lithium levels in drinking water increase autism risk: Study

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: US-based Astrolab has announced that it will be launching its first rover to the Moon, FLEX, on SpaceX's Starship flight. Upon completion of this mission, FLEX will become the "largest and most capable rover to ever travel to the Moon", the firm said. It's designed to act as an unpressurised rover for a crew of two astronauts on the Moon.
data.title: Astrolab to launch 'largest' Moon rover via SpaceX's Starship

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Hyderabad-based space tech startup Skyroot Aerospace on Tuesday announced it has successfully test fired a 3D-printed cryogenic rocket engine. The engine, named Dhawan-II, lasted for 200 seconds during an endurance test conducted at a facility in Nagpur. Skyroot, which last year became first Indian private company to launch a rocket into space, will use Dhawan-II for its Vikram II rocket.
data.title: Skyroot successfully tests 3D-printed cryogenic rocket engine

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru have designed a novel, tiny device capable of storing an enormous amount of electric charge. As per IISc, the ultra-micro supercapacitor is much smaller and more compact than existing supercapacitors. It has potential applications in consumer electronics, electric cars and medical devices, IISc added.
data.title: IISc designs tiny device that can store enormous electric charge

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Canadian astronaut Jeremy Roger Hansen is set to become the first non-American to fly to the moon as a mission specialist for Artemis II. Hansen has a bachelor's degree in space science and a master's in physics. He joined the Royal Canadian Air Cadet Squadron at 12. He has been a crew member of the NASA Extreme Environment Mission Operations.
data.title: Who is Jeremy Hansen, the first non-American to fly to moon?

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Researchers have released a video of the sounds that plants make when they are under stress. Every plant and stress is associated with a specific sound. These high-frequency sounds are inaudible to humans but can be heard by animals like bats, mice and insects, researchers added. The sound's volume is similar to human speech and resembles the popping of popcorn.
data.title: Plants make sounds under stress, researchers release video

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: A Japanese company is set to launch Sky Canvas, a project that will use satellites to create the world's first human-made artificial meteor shower in 2025. It aims to gather atmospheric data in the mesosphere, including wind speed and composition, while also studying the shooting stars' path and light emission. This data will help scientists in developing new weather models.
data.title: World’s first man-made meteor shower to take place in 2025

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Moons orbiting starless planets may retain enough liquid water for emergence of life, a study stated. The gravitational pull between the moon and the free-floating planet can warm up the moon to sustain liquid water long enough for life to emerge, it added. Astronomers believe that some exomoons orbiting such rogue planets can stay warm for over a billion years.
data.title: Moons of some starless planets may support life: Study

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Astronomers have detected a "coherent" radio signal from an Earth-sized planet, YZ Ceti b, suggesting the planet has its own magnetic field. The rocky planet orbits a star about 12 light-years away from Earth. The radio waves the researchers detected from the planet appear to have been generated when the star interacts with its planet's magnetic field.
data.title: Astronomers detect 'coherent' radio signal from Earth-sized planet

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: US President Joe Biden shared a video of him speaking to NASA's Artemis ll mission's astronauts and their kids over a call on Monday. "The...mission...will inspire the next generation of explorers, and show every child...that if they can dream it, they can be it," Biden said. "I want to thank you for your incredible service," he told the crew.
data.title: US President Biden speaks to Artemis ll astronauts, shares video

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: China-based Beijing Tianbing Technology successfully launched a kerosene-oxygen rocket on Sunday, becoming the first private Chinese launch company to send a liquid-propellant rocket into space. The non-reusable Tianlong-2 rocket was launched from the Jiuquan launch centre in northwest China. Beijing Tianbing will launch a larger Tianlong-3 rocket with a reusable first stage in the future.
data.title: In a first, private Chinese firm launches kerosene-oxygen rocket

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: NASA's Perseverance rover has collected and stored the first sample of the mission's newest science campaign. The sample, cored from a rock the team calls "Berea", is the 16th cored rock sample of the mission. The team believes that Berea formed from rock deposits that were carried downstream by an ancient river to the location.
data.title: Perseverance rover stores 1st Mars sample of new science campaign

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: NASA has established Moon to Mars Program Office to prepare for human spaceflight missions to Moon and Mars. The office will focus on hardware development, mission integration, and risk management to help NASA in accomplishing major goals, like landing humans on Mars. The office will be headquartered in Washington and support critical programs important for NASA's space exploration.
data.title: NASA sets up 'Moon to Mars' office to 'land first humans' on Mars

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: US Vice President Kamala Harris took to Twitter to tell NASA's Artemis ll astronauts, "The President and I could not be more proud of you." "Your courage and conviction inspire our nation. You will help generations of young people see themselves in the future of space," she added. She also said that the four astronauts are "breaking barriers".
data.title: Couldn't be more proud of you: Kamala Harris to Artemis II crew

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: NASA astronaut Victor Glover is set to become the first black person to fly to Moon as a pilot on Artemis II. Born in California, Glover holds multiple degrees and certificates in engineering, space systems and legislative studies. He has flown over 40 aircraft, participated in 24 combat missions, and made over 400 carrier-arrested landings, accumulating over 3,000 flight hours.
data.title: Who is Victor Glover, the first black person to fly to moon?

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: A Cambridge student has designed plastic windows to replace the bullet and bomb-damaged windows in Ukrainian homes. The window, designed by Blakiston Houston, is already in use by many people to keep their homes warm. The design uses polyethylene, PVC piping, pipe insulation and duct tape, to create four layers of insulation, and costs around £12/square metre of a window.
data.title: UK student designs plastic windows for bomb-hit Ukrainian homes

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter set a new flight speed record of 14.5 miles per hour on its 49th flight on the Red Planet. It also set a new altitude record of 52.5 feet. So far, the helicopter has flown 11,224 metres. Ingenuity, which landed on Mars on February 18, 2021, has completed 12 flights this year.
data.title: NASA's Mars helicopter sets new flight speed record of 14.5 mph
